bibl.title: George Daly v. J.H. McGraw. Writ.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: In the District Court holding terms at Seattle, King County, Washington Territory
In the Matter of the application of George R. Daily, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
United States of America to J.H. McGraw, Greeting:
div1.p: You are hereby commanded that you have the body of George R. Daily by you imprisioned anddetained as it is said. Together with the time and cause of said imprisionment and detention, by whatsoever name said George R. Daily shall be called or charged, before Roger S. Greene Judge of the Third Judicial District of the Territory of Washington holding terms at the city of Seattle, King County, Washington Territory in and for the County of King, at his chambers at the court house in the said City of Seattle, on the 17 day of March A.D. 1884, at 10 o'clock in the A.M. of that day to do and recieve what shall then and there be considered concerning the said George R. Daily, and have you then then and there this writ.
div1.ab: Witness the Hon. Roger S. Greene, Judge of the Third Judicial District holding terms at Seattle, in and for the County of King, this 18th day of March, 1884.
Attest my hand and seal of the said court the day and year last above written
James Seavey, Clerk By James P Ludlow Deputy.
No. 3748 In the District Court 3d Judicial District, holding terms at Seattle Washington Territory.
In the matter of the application of George R Daily Plaintiff for a writ of Habeas Corpus Defendant
Writ. Filed Mch 17 1884 James Seavey Clerk. By James P Ludlow Deputy.
